content: तेजस् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [तिज्-भावे करुणादौ असुन्] {@--1@} Sharpness. {@--2@} The sharp edge (of a knife &c.). {@--3@} The point or top of a flame. {@--4@} Heat, glow, glare. {@--5@} Lustre, light, brilliance, splendour; <ls>R. 4. 1</ls>; <ls>Bg. 7. 9</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">10. 30.</ls> {@--6@} Heat or light considered as the third of the five elements of creation (the other four being पृथिवी, अप्, वायु, and आकाश). {@--7@} The bright appearance of the human body, beauty; <ls>R. 3. 15.</ls> {@--8@} Fire of energy; <ls>Ś. 2. 7</ls>, <ls>U. 6. 14.</ls> {@--9@} Might, prowess, strength, courage, valour, martial or heroic lustre; तेजस्तेजसि शाम्यतु <ls>U. 5. 7</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 15.</ls> {@--10@} One possessed of heroic lustre; तेजसां हि न वयः ससीक्ष्यते <ls>R. 11. 1</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1. 328</ls>, <ls n="Pt.">3. 33.</ls> {@--11@} Spirit, energy. {@--12@} Strength of character, not bearing insult or ill-treatment with impunity. {@--13@} Majestic lustre, majesty, dignity, authority, consequence; तेजोविशेषानुमितां ( राजलक्ष्मीं) दधानः <ls>R. 2. 7.</ls> {@--14@} Semen, seed, semen virile; स्याद्रक्षणीयं यदि मे न तेजः <ls>R. 14. 65</ls>; <ls n="R.">2. 75</ls>; दुष्यंतेनाहितं तेजो दधानां भूतये भुवः <ls>Ś. 4. 3.</ls> {@--15@} The essential nature of any thing. {@--16@} Essence, quint-essence. {@--17@} Spiritual, moral, or magical power. {@--18@} Fire. {@--19@} Marrow. {@--20@} Bile. {@--21@} The speed of a horse. {@--22@} Fresh butter. {@--23@} Gold. {@--24@} Clearness of the eyes. {@--25@} A shining or luminous body, light; <ls>Ku. 1. 51</ls>, <ls>Ś. 4. 2.</ls> {@--26@} The heating and strengthening faculty of the human frame seated in the bile (पित्त). {@--27@} The brain. {@--28@} Violence, fierceness. {@--29@} Impatience.
